data:
Facsimile Images

ἐπὶ ἱεραπόλου Τελίνε[--- τ]ο[ῦ] Α[---]
Γ[---]

Apparatus criticus

Text of IG

translation

commentary

The name Τηλίνης is attested at Gela in Herodotos 7.153. It seems unlikely that this inscription is genuine: the similar text preserved as ISic001079 = IG XIV.259 is almost certainly a late 18th century fake, and this one appears to have similar context (see principally the discussion of Pareti); the reproduction of the name from Herodotus adds to the doubt. (Note that Carità mis-references this as IG XIV.259.)

bibliography

    14.0258 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001072 Schubring 1873 75 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002684 Pareti 1914 214-220 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002680 1959.0288 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001283 Carità 1978 21-22 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002089
